ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Radio JOVE AJ4CO Dual Dipole Array and Radio JOVE 20.1 MHz Data

RevisionEvent.Note: RadioJOVE: Resource Header Description reformated, One URL corrected for // typo in some files. Metadata submitted by J.M. Weygand on 2021-11-08, reviewed by LFB

ResourceHeader.Description:
RadioJOVE Single Frequency Data Product. This data set consists of observations made at the AJ4CO Observatory using a Dual Dipole Array and a 20.1 MHz Radio JOVE direct conversion receiver, 7 kHz Bandwidth. These data are generated using the Radio Sky-Pipe Software.
These data may include observations of Solar Radio Bursts, Jupiter decametric radio emission, or Galactic Background radio emission.
The Radio-SkyPipe produced datafiles consist of a fixed length header and a variable length note. The data portion of the file for one channel of data consists of an 8 byte timestamp using the VisualBasic 6 date format (days since 1 Jan 1900) followed by one 8 byte data value (Channel 1), this pattern repeats until the end of file. More details can be found in the Data File Structure document on the Radio-SkyPipe help page (see Information URL).

InformationURL.Name: Radio Jove Spectrograph Users Group (SUG)
InformationURL.Description: Available at this site is a description of the Observatory facilities, a manual for the Dual Dipole antenna, and a guide to reading the binary data file produced by the Radio-SkyPipe software.

InformationURL.Name: Radio Sky Publishing Radio-SkyPipe Help Page
InformationURL.Description: The page "Radio-SkyPipe data file structure" describes the file standard.

InformationURL.Name: AJ4CO Radio Astronomy Publications
InformationURL.Description: This site provides descriptions of radio receiver systems at AJ4CO as well as other radio astronomy-related documentation

InformationURL.Name: AJ4CO Miscellaneous Data
InformationURL.Description: This site provides descriptions of radio receiver systems at AJ4CO, observation logs and other documentation

AccessURL.Name: Radio JOVE AJ4CO Radio-SkyPipe data held at the Planetary Plasma Interactions node of the Planetary Data System

Parameter.Name: Time
Parameter.Description: The time array of the data. The time resolution is variable but is typically set at about 0.1 seconds ( that is about 10 samples/second)

Parameter.Name: Channel 1: sound card left, average detection method
